article.title: sublimation
article.p:
sublimation
An example of sublimation is the conversion of solid carbon dioxide (dry ice) to carbon dioxide gas.
© Reika/Shutterstock.com
sublimation
,
in physics, conversion of a substance from the
solid
to the
gaseous state
without its becoming
liquid
. An example is the
vaporization
of frozen carbon dioxide (
dry ice
) at ordinary
atmospheric pressure
and
temperature
. The phenomenon is the result of
vapour pressure
and temperature relationships. Freeze-drying of food to preserve it involves sublimation of water from the food in a frozen state under high vacuum.
See also
vaporization
;
phase diagram
.
